author: sky.cactus
content: <@636212126939217941> The attack described is basically a 51% attack.  It is already well known that a 51% miner attack can do lots of bad things, so I'm not terribly concerned about that.

author: sky.cactus
content: Proof of Stake is the solution to 51% miner attacks to some extent, 1559 doesn't really make it significantly worse.

author: sky.cactus
content: IMO a strong argument against 1559 would need to show that the selfish strategy for a non-51% miner is an unhealthy strategy for the network.  I haven't seen any such argument yet, but am open to seeing one.

author: sky.cactus
content: I don't think this one counts.

author: tbsn.
content: I'm hearing about EIP1559 for so long now. Any concrete info on when there is a chance for it to be implemented?

author: timbeiko
content: <@!381004301973323776> I'd say the fork after Berlin *at the earliest*. Could take longer.

author: timbeiko
content:
**EIP-1559 Implementers' Call #3 is scheduled for June 24th, 19:00 UTC**
Agenda: https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/184
Call will be streamed on YT and zoom link will be posted here before. 

My goals for the call would be to get to a resolution on if and how we want to bundle 1559 and escalator fees (for now), and how we go about testing/analyzing the fee market changes. Feel free to leave comments to add things to the agenda.

Edit: call moved to the 24th.

author: sky.cactus
content: I won't be able to make it but my vote is strongly against bundling the EIPs, but I do fully support having an escalator EIP that `requires` 1559.

author: sky.cactus
content: As for which strategy to use, I am moderately in favor of escalating the `GAS_PREMIUM` over time, with a cap.
